Competing Risk Calibration

calibrate.Rd

This function will allow you to compute calibration metrics: - predicted and observed probabilities - predicted and observed events of interest

calibrate(data, horizon, groups = 10, cause = 1, model)

Arguments

data

Dataframe to use for absolute risk predictions
horizon

Time horizon for predictions
groups

Number of deciles based on model-predicted risks (default is 10)
cause

Integer value for the event-of-interest to calibrate predictions
model

The returened model object from riskRegression

Value

A list containing three elements. The first element returns a string detailing the time horizon for calibration. The second element is a chi-sq test statistic and p-value for the Hosmer-Lemeshow test (with DF=groups-1). The third element is a tibble containining the decile index along with the predicted and observed cumulative incidences, and the predicted and observed events across the n risk quantiles.

Examples

library(riskRegression)
#> Loading required package: data.table
#> Loading required package: ggplot2
#> Loading required package: prodlim
#> riskRegression version 2018.10.03

# Simulate Data
sim.data <- sampleData(100, outcome = 'competing.risks')

# Fit Fine-Gray Model
fgr.mod <- FGR(formula = Hist(time, event) ~ X7 + X6 + X8 + X9,
               data = sim.data, cause = 1)

calibrate(sim.data, 2, 10, 1, fgr.mod)
#> Error: Column `pred` must be a 1d atomic vector or a list
